fields.label: Mechanical & Physical
fields.name: mechanical
fields.instructions:
The fibre is mounted between two clamps, then pulled (stretched) until it breaks. The pulling force vs fibre density gives the tenacity (cN/dtex or cN/tex).  ￼

The elongation at break is calculated from how much it has stretched compared to its initial length at the point of break.

sub_fields.label: Moisture regain (% @ 20 °C, 65% RH)
sub_fields.name: moisture_regain_%_@_20_°c_65%_rh_
sub_fields.instructions:
Moisture-regain is calculated as the weight of water absorbed (W) divided by the oven-dry weight of the fibre (D), then ×100.  ￼

So if a fibre has a moisture-regain of 8.5 %, that means if you take a sample when completely dry, then let it equilibrate at 20 °C / 65 % RH, the moisture weight will be 8.5 % of the original dry weight.
